pageContext.claim: “We got the remains back [from North Korea], and they continue to come. We have the sanctions on in full.”
pageContext.analysis: In May 2019, the U.S. government said it suspended its effort to retrieve American remains from North Korea, an effort that has long been touted by President Donald Trump as evidence of the success of his first Singapore summit with Kim Jong Un. The Defense POW/MIA Accounting Agency said that the effort was suspended due to a lack of communication from North Korean officials following the second summit between the two leaders in Hanoi earlier this year.
